task.title: DO NOT INCLUDE THIS TOPIC WHOLESALE

step.cmd: Configure and start the Docker service.

substep.cmd: Create a variable for the name of the Docker thin pool.

stepxmp.p: Replace Thin-Pool-Device with the name of the thin pool device created in the previous step:

substep.cmd: Create a variable for the master host.

stepxmp.p: Replace Master with the virtual hostname (HA-Virtual-Name) or IPv4 address (HA-Virtual-IP) of the high-availability cluster:
The value of this variable must match the value of the SERVICED_DOCKER_REGISTRY variable in /etc/default/serviced.

substep.cmd: Create variables for adding arguments to the Docker configuration file. The --exec-opt argument is a workaround for a Docker issue on RHEL/CentOS 7.x systems.

stepxmp.codeblock: myDriver="--storage-driver devicemapper" myLog="--log-level=error" myFix="--exec-opt native.cgroupdriver=cgroupfs" myMount="--storage-opt dm.mountopt=discard" myFlag="--storage-opt dm.thinpooldev=$myPool" myReg="--insecure-registry=myCluster:5000"

substep.cmd: Add the arguments to the Docker configuration file.

substep.stepresult: The startup may take up to a minute, and may fail. If startup fails, repeat the restart command.
